content.rendered:
MinecraftChina is a variant of Minecraft. Its original name is simply “Minecraft” (Chinese: 我的世界中国版), with a Creeper face on one character. This Minecraft variant was specially produced for China because only access to Chinese shops, app stores and servers is allowed there. The Minecraft manufacturer Mojang has entered into a partnership with the Chinese company NetEase, which has reprogrammed the game.

requirements[]

  • You don’t need a Mojang account to play, you need a NetEase account. The launcher also comes from NetEase.
  • Registration for the NetEase account is only possible for Chinese people. For this purpose, the real name, ID card number and telephone number are checked during the extensive registration process. A verification code will be sent to the phone number via SMS. The form can only be filled out in the original language, if it appears translated it will not work.

Characteristics[]

  • This edition is free because there are already a lot of free illegal Minecraft versions in the Chinese app stores[1].
  • The NetEase launcher has a built-in download facility, similar to the marketplace. There are not only resource and skin packs available for download, but also modifications. The offers come from the community. Some offers are free, some are paid. Some things you pay for with diamonds, which you have to buy (similar to Minecraft coins), for others with emeralds, which you get if you go online every day.
  • The launcher also has an integrated friends system.
  • The game cannot be started in offline mode.
  • A version number is not displayed in the game.
  • The game is playable on PC (Java) and mobile devices (Android and iOS).
  • The adjustments to the Java Edition are made through modifications, the Modloader Forge and some modifications (including OptiFine) are automatically integrated.
  • There is no language selection, Chinese is fixed.
  • Steve and Alex skins are free, additional skins are paid.
  • The worlds are not stored locally, but in the NetEase cloud.
  • The multiplayer mode is possible in LAN, with the paid Minecraft Realms or with some predetermined servers.
  • There is no progression in the Bedrock Edition.

National Animal Vote[]

From September 7th to 20th, 2018 there was a vote for Minecraft China[2], which is one of five national animals of China to be included in Minecraft. The big panda or giant panda won by a wide margin. Here the result:

  • 1st Place: Giant Panda (466,490 votes)
  • 2nd place: Chinese alligator (118,080 votes)
  • 3rd place: snub-nosed monkey (85,774 votes)
  • 4th place: White-lipped deer (53,433 votes)
  • 5th place: Chinese river dolphin (47,825 votes)

A week later at MineCon, it was announced that the giant panda would be included in all editions of the game before the end of the year.

story[]

Version history of the Java Edition
May 20, 2016
  • Mojang announces a partnership with the Chinese company NetEase, which will program a China Edition for mobile devices and PCs[3]
April 7, 2017
  • At a big event in Beijing and in the presence of Mojang and Microsoft officials, NetEase releases the closed beta version of the game[4][5]
April 10, 2017
  • The non-public beta test begins, you must have an invitation to participate
April 28, 2017
  • The non-public beta server will be closed
May 21, 2017
  • The Minecraft server Hypixel announces that there will be a Hypixel server for the China Edition[6]
July 14, 2017
  • The non-public beta test for the Java version starts on a new server, the Hypixel team has been involved from the start[7]
August 8, 2017
  • The beta test for the Java version becomes public[8]
September 15, 2017
  • The mobile version is available in the App Store[9]
October 12, 2017
  • Public beta testing for the Android version begins[10]a week later there are already over 14 million players[11]
October 31, 2017
  • There are 30 million players[12]
January 30, 2018
  • There are 60 million players[13]
May 23, 2018
  • There are 100 million players[14]
